alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 04 at 3:13AM EST until February 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS CONTINUE... .The core of the cold air mass is starting to lift northeast of the forecast area this morning. Temperatures and wind chills will gradually improve but are expected to remain dangerous through sunrise for much of the area and mid afternoon in the mountains. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen in as little as 10 minutes. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
